question.title: How do I properly invalidate and clear a Caffeine cache
question.body:
I am struggling to properly invalidate the cache.

import com.github.benmanes.caffeine.cache.Caffeine;
import com.github.benmanes.caffeine.cache.LoadingCache;

import java.util.*;
import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;

class Trial2 {
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        LoadingCache<Integer, Temp> cache = Caffeine.newBuilder()
                .maximumSize(5)
                .removalListener( (key, value, cause) -> {
                    try {
                        ((AutoCloseable) value).close();
                    } catch (Exception e) {
                        throw new RuntimeException(e);
                    }
                })
                .build(Trial2::getObj);

        Random random = new Random();
        for (int i = 0; i < 1000000; i++) {
            int value = random.nextInt(1000);
            var found = cache.get(value);
            if (found.isClosed) {
                cache.invalidate(value);
                cache.cleanUp();
                found = cache.get(value);
            }
            if (found.getValue() != value) {
                throw new IllegalStateException("Value mismatch: expected " + value + ", got " + found.getValue());
            }
        }
        System.out.println("All values matched successfully!");
    }

    private static Temp getObj(int value) {
        System.out.println("Creating obj for value: " + value);
        return new Temp(value);
    }
}

class Temp implements AutoCloseable {
    private final int value;
    public volatile boolean isClosed = false;
    private ReentrantLock lock = new ReentrantLock();

    public Temp(int value) {
        this.value = value;
    }

    public int getValue() {
        lock.lock();
        try {
            if (isClosed) {
                throw new IllegalStateException("This object is closed");
            }
            return value;
        }finally {
            lock.unlock();
        }
    }

    @Override
    public void close() throws Exception {
        lock.lock();
        try {
            System.out.println("Closing class with value: " + value);
            isClosed = true;
        } finally {
            lock.unlock();
        }
    }
}

i even tried

 if (found.isClosed) {
    cache.asMap().remove(value);
    found = cache.get(value);
 }

Still

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalStateException: This object is closed
    at Temp.getValue(idk.java:57)
    at Trial2.main(idk.java:31)

I was planning on using the cache in a multi-threaded environment too.

I tried some of the solutions provided on the internet, like, to remove the key from the map, cache.asMap().remove(value);

I'm still puzzled on what am I doing wrong. Is it to do with object being stateful?
